result.execSummary:
The defendant Meaghan B Terbeest was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Meaghan B Terbeest
Current: PO Box 479, 750 E Division St, Fond du Lac, WI 54935 United States  (Effective: 09-28-2016)
Prior: 200 N High St, Markesan, WI 53946

10:08 a.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to count 1 in 2015CM171 and count 1 in 2016CM86 and count 2 will be dismissed and read-in.  State concurs.  Atty Privat concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 in 2015CM171 and on count 1 in 2016CM86.  Court orders count 2 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Privat.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to: 

2015CM171 (count 1) 

30 days county jail, stayed and places the defendant on probation for 1 year.

CONDITIONS:

-Court costs.
-AODA and any follow-up.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

2016CM86 (count 1)

SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 1 year.

CONDITIONS:

-Court costs.
-AODA and any follow-up.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Court adjourned at 10:16 A.M.

3:02 P.M.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Barb Privat present.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - defendant is in custody in our jail and requests this matter be put on the calendar for July 6, 2016 at 10:00 a.m.  Court puts this matter on the calendar for 07/06 at 10:00 a.m.

Court adjourned at 3:02 p.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 5, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

2:21 p.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Barb Privat present.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - have an offer on both cases and need a date.  Court sets for plea & sentencing on July 5, 2016 at 2:00 p.m.  Mandatory appearance.

Court adjourned at 2:22 p.m.
Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.
Status hearing on May 24, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

8:59 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Privat confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Atty Privat enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond and conditions of:  Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.  Court will set for Status Hearing on May 24, 2016 at 2:00 p.m.

Court adjourned at 9:00 a.m.
